label: Health Program Evaluation
description: Use of research methods and theory for evaluation of initiatives and programs in public health and medical care. Emphasis on acquiring skills in evaluation and conducting evaluations whose results have impact on public health practice. Covers different theories and perspectives on health evaluation. Review of published evaluations used to illustrate research methods and practical issues in program evaluation. Prerequisite: MPH student or consent of instructor.
courseSectionInformation: Prerequisite: MPH student or consent of instructor.
sectionRegistrationNotes: Restricted to Public Health or Public Health (MPH) major(s).
